On Thu, 16 Dec 2004 12:58:17 -0500, Jason Rogers
>> Sorry, wrong book in mind. I meant this one that Kent co-authored
>> with Erich Gamma:

>> http://www.aw-bc.com/catalog/academic/product/0,1144,0321205758,00.html

 _Contributing to Eclipse_

Jeff Waltzer Fri, 17 Dec 2004 08:58:51 -0500
> Looks interesting I will check it out. From reading the decription
> if the book it still looks like I'm going to have to setup (mock?)
> plugins to be able to test simple SWT constructs.

No, but since it's a book about plugins, that's what they discuss.
Actually you will probably have more difficulty with the following:

* (unless there's a newer version out) C2E is based on 2.1.1. SWT, as
  with much of the workbench, changed a lot in 3.0: threading and
  thread access are much more important. (If anyone knows about a 3.x
  version of C2E, please post.)

* IIRC it doesn't do much UI testing. E.g. in Circle 2 (where they
  start developing UI) they do stuff like counting listeners and
  actions. But since you're not interested in real testing (e.g.
  automating interaction with the UI), this might not be a problem.
